page.title: 11E. CHARMINSTER - THE PAST
page.content: Dorset is rich in history, and even this small section of the county has reminders of the past. Fifteen tumuli are noted on the maps, plus two mounds. There is a chalk pit, and also a disused chalk pit. Evidence of medieval fields systems can still be seen on Little Piddle Down and Charlton Higher Down. There is an Iron Age Farm site between Holcombe Bottom and Charlton Higher Down. Running alongside Charlton Higher Down is the old Drove Road, the medieval highway. Charlton Down is now enclosed with hedges. Foxbrake Wood has been cleared, and is now used for arable farming - in 1985 it was Winter Wheat.
